definition: Assessing whether retrieved items satisfy the information need, distinguishing relevant from irrelevant results

positive_examples: Relevance judgment determined that despite the keyword match, the paper addressed a different phenomenon.
Quick relevance judgment scanned titles and abstracts before examining full texts.
Relevance assessment distinguished marginally relevant background from directly pertinent sources.
The relevance judgment considered not just topical match but methodological appropriateness.
training_hints.disambiguation: Discriminating assessment of result utility, not mere review
